attributes.action: Introduce an Electronic Voting System to stop Voting Fraud
attributes.background: Voting Fraud is happening in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
The people of the UK request that before the next General Election a new voting procedure be put into place.     The system should  have the ability to stamp out voter fraud and should be able to check for multiple voting  which is happening  in some areas of the UK.      Some form of electronic voting using your  National Insurance number or even the issuing an identify card would be ideal.  

Postal voting should only be available to the elderly and severely disabled.    

Penalties for illegal voting and multiple voting should be severe and classed as a criminal conviction, a £5,000 fine, and a ban from voting for at least 10 years.

The voting system should apply to the whole of the UK.... no exceptions

attributes.action: Lower the age a stillborn can legally be registered.
attributes.background: It should be the parents’ choice whether to have a birth certificate. All stillborn babies should be able to be registered if that’s what the parents want. I ask as many people as possible to sign this petition, email your MPs and raise awareness so these babies get recognition.
attributes.additional_details:
We were given the devastating news at 16 weeks that our baby girl will not survive after birth, and there is nothing we can do to save her. Nothing. I am going to lose my Little Bean.
 
We were offered a termination, but then told our little girl will never legally exist. I have chosen to carry my baby girl until 24 weeks so she gets the recognition she deserves. Every day I feel her kick and grow, knowing I am one day closer to saying goodbye. 8 long weeks.
 
It is torture, its heart breaking.

attributes.action:
Abolish 0.7% GDP target for Foreign Aid spending
Spend OUR money at home
attributes.background:
The budget for Foreign Aid spending has increased to £14bn.
We believe that it is wrong that our own Government spends our taxes abroad when our NHS is in crisis and police budgets are under pressure. 
It is time to Stop the Foreign Aid Madness and spend OUR money at home on NHS and our police.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory fluoridation of the water supply to prevent tooth decay
attributes.background: Tooth decay is almost entirely preventable, but is the most common reason why children aged 5 to 9 require hospital admission. Water fluoridation is an effective public health measure proven to reduce tooth decay. Centrally funded and mandated water fluoridation is needed to protect our oral health.
attributes.additional_details:
PHE recommends fluoridation, but cannot enforce it. It's within the remit of local authorities, many of which do not have funds to implement it. 31 to 41% of 5-year-old children have evidence of tooth decay, with higher rates in deprived populations. 

PHE research reveals:

- 15% fewer 5-year-olds with tooth decay in fluoridated areas, rising to 28% when deprivation is considered
- 45% fewer hospital admissions of children aged 1 to 4 for tooth decay in fluoridated areas

attributes.action: Issue an RAF centenary medal to all serving RAF personnel.
attributes.background: The RAF celebrates its centenary year in 2018 and given its illustrious past and its continued contribution to the safety and security of the United Kingdom, a centenary medal should be issued to all serving members of the RAF who achieve permanent service within the Royal Air Force during 2018.

attributes.action: Provide free sanitary products to young women receiving free school meals
attributes.background: Recent media reports have highlighted issues relating to what is being described as period poverty. 137,700 UK girls miss school each year in addition to putting their health at risk trying to manage without these essential items. Cannock Soroptimists believe funding is needed to end period poverty.
attributes.additional_details: SI Cannock have established that this is both a local and national issue. The following links provide further information:- https://www.always.co.uk/en-gb/about-us/endperiodpoverty http://www.itv.com/news/central/2018-03-15/period-poverty-the-women-forced-to-choose-between-food-and-sanitary-products/ https://inews.co.uk/inews-lifestyle/women/period-poverty-girls-toilet-roll-afford-tampons/

attributes.action: Stop plans to cut Cannon Street trains on the Hayes (Kent) train line
attributes.background: Following a government consultation on the future of south eastern rail services, the secretary for State for Transport is recommending that companies bidding for the south eastern train franchise should make their bid based on the proposed change to cut services to Cannon Street from 2022.
attributes.additional_details: The Hayes line would in future run to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria. The paper states that the ‘ small number of passengers who currently travel to Cannon Street, would need to change at London Bridge’.  The trains to Cannon Street are already extremely busy with no seats available by the time the trains reach Catford. Cutting the services would have a huge impact on local commuters, not only increasing their travel time but also further overcrowding at London Bridge.

attributes.action: To instigate signage and digital displays directing to the nearest defibrillator
attributes.background: Studies show that the public are often not aware of where the nearest defibrillator is should a cardiac arrest occur.  Although provided with directions when making a 999 call, the person may not have local knowledge.  Precious time could be wasted in locating the defibrillator.
attributes.additional_details:
Cardiac charity SADS UK believes community defibrillators should have signposts to direct people to quickly access this lifesaving equipment.  Roadside signage posts could be used, also digital information boards at bus shelters and rail stations.
Initially 999 must be dialled to despatch the ambulance; the rescuer uses directions given to locate the nearest defibrillator. Rescuers seeing a sign giving directions to the defibrillator will be assured they are heading in the right direction, saving precious minutes in reaching the defibrillator.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for sunbed shops to display signs showing skin cancer symptoms
attributes.background: I was recently diagnosed with a form of skin cancer malignant melanoma at the age of 28. I was an avid sunbed user. Sunbed businesses have a duty of care to their customers and it should be mandatory for sunbed businesses to display signage showing skin cancer symptoms. This would help save lives.
attributes.additional_details: The health case for the request of the change in the law is clear: skin cancer incidence is increasing.There are around 136,000 non-melanoma skin cancer cases in the UK every year (2013-2015) however IRAC (International Agency for Research on Cancer) agrees there is sufficient evidence to show that using sunbeds causes Melanoma skin cancer, the most serious form. Malignant melanoma can spread to other organs and is responsible for the most deaths. In 2015 there were over 15,906 incidences of malignant melanoma in the UK and 2459 deaths. Showing those most at risk what symptoms to look for will save lives.

attributes.action: Provide all student nurses and midwives with additional maintenance loan
attributes.background: At the moment, healthcare students are given the same maintenance loans that all undergraduates apply for - this basic rate is made on the average course length of 30 weeks 3 days and ignores the requirements of our course length.
attributes.additional_details: I am currently a first year student studying in Manchester. Like many others, we are currently expected to make our third loan instalment last from April till September which includes essential fees such as uniform, travel expenses and living costs. Working a minimum of 22.5 weekly unpaid placement hours, attending university and studying leaves us little opportunity to take up a part-time job and therefore fund ourselves.

attributes.action: 16 and 17 year olds should be allowed to vote in any future Brexit referendum
attributes.background: Young people are affected more deeply than older people by the result of the Brexit referendum, as their lives will be changed for very many more years. However, young people aged 16 to 17 were not allowed to vote in the 2016 referendum, in contrast to the Scottish independence referendum of 2014.
attributes.additional_details: Are 16-17 year olds immature people, not to be trusted with serious political decisions? I don't think so. These days, teenagers are hounded with pressure to find work experience or summer courses during their holidays, even if they have only just finished their GCSEs.  When teenagers are forced to be hard-working adults so early, the least they deserve is to have some say over their future. If there is another referendum on any aspect of Brexit, teenagers aged 16-17 ought to have a voice.

attributes.action: Routinely test pregnant women for infections such as Group B Strep and more.
attributes.background: October 2017 the devastating news no parents want to here “your daughters heartbeat has gone”. I was suffering with an infection and Sepsis, while showing no early symptoms no one could of known I was ill with an infection, until they did a swab whilst in labour.
attributes.additional_details:
During pregnancy infections can be deadly to both baby and the mother, if my infection was picked up sooner It possibly could of been prevented and antibiotics could of been provided.

Infections during pregnancy are common such as Staphylococcus aureus and Group B Streptococcus. The NHS don’t routinely swab for any infections. If I had been tested around my due date when I'd been given the option to have an examination my infection possibly could of been prevented and any other infections could of possibly been picked up. If an examination is being taken place then a swab could be conducted to pick up any possible infections and stop babies, mothers becoming ill and prevent these types of stillbirths.

attributes.action: Make home to school disabled transport free for young adults aged 16 to 19
attributes.background:
I am a parent of a child with a disability. She begins college in 2019 and has no choice but to travel to one approx. 30 minutes drive away. This is our local SEN college and transport will cost over £900pa. 
I ask to review this legislation to ensure that all children can access a free education.
attributes.additional_details: Disabled home to school transport provided by the local authority is free for children up to age 16 as outlined in current disabled legislation. However after 16 this is no longer the case although it is compulsory for a child to stay in a form of education until they are 18. Many children with disabilities stay until 19+. This begs the question as to why disabled school transport is payable after 16. It isn’t means tested and families on low income/benefits will still have to pay up to £900+pa.

attributes.action: To upgrade all English bridleways to byways.
attributes.background:
Opening up England’s bridleways would have a fantastic impact on the UKs health and pump more money into the UK economy. 
This change is mainly aimed for the trail riding community, estimated at 10,000 people.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent study in the European Journal of Applied Physiology demonstrated that riding a motorcycle on unsurfaced roads two to four times a week reduced blood pressure and body fat. 
These changes reduce the risk of diabetes and cardiovascular disease. 
Research indicates that riders spend an average of £5000 equipping themselves to take up trail riding, estimated 10,000 UK riders equates to £50 million. 
UK trail riders spend approximately £8.5 million per year on consumable items and insurance.

attributes.action: Make Food and Farming education in UK schools part of the curriculum
attributes.background: Children and young people are becoming more disconnected than ever from where their food comes from or how it is produced. Is it right that out of 27,500 children 1/3 thought cheese was made from plants? Additionally, 1/4 thought fish fingers were made from chicken or pork. (BBC News, 2013).
attributes.additional_details: Food production represents the single largest human use of land. Why is food production not part of the curriculum? The increasing influence of social media can lead to dramatic lifestyle changes and criticism, often based on myths surrounding farming practices and confusion with those which happen outside of the UK. Informed choices can only be made if food and farming education becomes part of the curriculum in all UK schools in order to deliver unbiased facts to children and young adults.

attributes.action: Pass law requiring sponsors pay index-linked annual increases for DB pensioners
attributes.background: All company pensions should have annual index-linked increase, including those for pensioners that earned their benefits prior to 1997. This will not apply retrospectively but will ensure that in future all benefits earned during the working life of the pensioner are protected against inflation.
attributes.additional_details: In 1997 the Government passed a law that required index-linked annual pension increases on Defined Benefit (DB) pension sponsors. However pre 1997 service was excluded. There are some 100,000 pensioners who fall into this category. A fair solution would require relatively small amount of money. Many of the companies concerned took pension contribution holidays and benefited accordingly, have hidden behind the law and do not pay increments.It is not expected that increases should be retrospective

attributes.action: Ban websites from publishing videos that lead children to harm themselves
attributes.background: I lost my 14 year old son Jack Pickles to a craze called “The Choking “Game” / “Passing Out Challenge”. He died because he watched this so-called "game” on the internet and decided to try it. Children don't realise that these videos are often fake or can harm them or worse lead them to their deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to raise awareness of how dangerous these crazy upload fads can be. There are 12+ children I know that have died because of this “Choking Game” / “Passing Out Challenge” more children are getting hurt either though the same craze or other crazy games kids believe are safe.
Hundreds of children have been hurt, scarred for life or suffered life changing injuries because they see people's “Games” and think they can do the same thing because the uploader is ok. We need to keep our children safe

attributes.action: Motorcyclists to upgrade their CBT licence to ride a 250cc at 18
attributes.background: I believe that in order to decrease the jump in power, from a 125cc at 17 and 18, to 47bhp at 19, there should be an intermediate cc at 18, therefore I propose that at 18, a 125cc rider should be able to take another test, in order to ride a 250cc motorbike.
attributes.additional_details: Most riders jump from a 125cc to a restricted 600cc, which is way too much of a jump. 15bhp to 47bhp is more than enough to knock experienced 125cc riders off, if they're not careful. A smaller jump to 47bhp would increase safety for those who are willing to ride a 250cc at 18

attributes.action: Making false claims about military service should be a criminal offence
attributes.background: There seems to be an occurring theme in professional ex-service members lying or exaggerating their military service to enhance their professional or political career. It should be made a criminal offence to lie about one’s military career for personal gain.

attributes.action: The Government must intervene in the proposed GKN takeover
attributes.background: GKN is one of the last bastions of UK high-tech engineering, involved with automotive and defence contracts. Selling would be a threat to national security and, more importantly jobs! Protect our jobs and our future NOW.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May comes under mounting pressure to block the takeover of British engineering firm GKN
GKN is fighting off an unwanted £7.4billion bid from Melrose
Melrose said it wants to sell the company within three to five years for a profit
It is feared this would see GKN broken up and its parts sold across the world, harming UK industry and defence 


Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5398175/Theresa-comes-pressure-block-takeover-GKN.html#ixzz57GyAFQSr

attributes.action: Urge Israel to stop the deportation of African refugees to third countries.
attributes.background:
Dear Friends,
We are alarmed by the Israeli Government’s plan of deportation; if not reversed the refugees could face abductions, enslavement, torture, and death trying to reach Europe.

We urge you to sign this petition. 
Committee of Eritrean Unity for Justice – UK.
attributes.additional_details:
We are urging the UK Government to use its diplomatic clout to persuade the Israeli Government to stop deporting, the refugees and provide them protection under the UN Convention Article 33 (1) “No Contracting State shall expel or return a refugee in any manner whatsoever [...]”

Further detail see the link below https://storage.googleapis.com/wzukusers/user-28803632/documents/5a724e7fdb1ffzxNoqTu/Petition%20to%20stop%20the%20illegal%20deportation%20of%20African%20Refugees%20in%20Israel.pdf

attributes.action: Criminalise the export of cannabis
attributes.background: The government contradicts itself by telling the public that cannabis should not be legalised as it has no medicinal benefit however the United Kingdom is the biggest exporter of cannabis in the world. If it's illegal to sell on the streets it should be illegal to sell overseas.

attributes.action: Protect 20% PPA time for all teachers.
attributes.background: There is a teacher retention crisis at the moment and rather than address that with realistic aims to stop experienced teachers leaving the profession there are recruitment pushes to get more people to train to likely leave after 4 years.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of teachers would cite work/life balance as one of the biggest push factors, most would put this before salary.

The amount of unpaid overtime working evenings and weekends as standard is not sustainable and I would ask that all MPS teachers have a minimum of 20% protected PPA time.

Marking 13 class sets of books as well as planning excellent fully resourced and differentiated lessons in 126.5 hours a year is not achievable and needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Commit to a long-term funding plan for health & social care to the year 2035.
attributes.background: We are calling on the government to recognise the rising demand, underfunding and workforce crisis in the NHS and social care sector by committing to a long-term funding plan for health and social care to the year 2035.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is supported by the NHS Confederation.

attributes.action: Legalise medical cannabis for difficult to treat epilepsies in children.
attributes.background: Trials have taken place with medical cannabis on Dravet syndrome, the children on this trial have been able to continue to take sativex and this gives hope to other patients with refractory seizures. Sativex is available on special license for MS patients, please grant our children the same respect.
attributes.additional_details:
My daughter Ruby had her first seizure at 5 days old, her epilepsy has remained uncontrolled ever since. Ruby’s seizures are life threatening, she has a very rare & complex neurological condition called AHC. Please grant leading paediatric neurologists special license to prescribe sativex in special cases. To save children’s lives, to give quality of life to my daughter & many others. Thank you. 

More information on AHC can be found by watching this short film:

www.humantimebombs.com

attributes.action: Make domestic abusers sign a register
attributes.background: Domestic abuse will affect 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men in their lifetime and leads to, on average, two women being murdered each week and 30 men per year. By getting domestic abusers to sign a register, this could at least warn people before they decide to continue in a relationship with someone.

attributes.action: Stop pets being sold online. Many are by breeders, pup farmers, dog theft gangs.
attributes.background: This would drastically cut down this crime and animals being sourced as bait.   Rescues don’t sell, but charge a fee, in most cases won’t cover the vets bills.  Rescue are full to bursting, due to all these criminals who steal pets etc. I’m a member of many who’ll back me on this.
attributes.additional_details:
A good breeder only has pups if asked, I know one and they are in total agreement on this.   
They have a web page but don’t sell pups on it.  People get their pups,either through the kennel club or word of mouth.
There’s no way of regulating this, it’s a great outlet for those who just see these  animals as objects to make money from.  The only way to help put a stop to it altogether is to make it illegal!! 
Online is mainly how puppy farming, back yard breeders sell the manly sickly pups they breed.
 People’s pets are mainly stolen to either sell online or backyard breed from them.

attributes.action: Require in law that branding/ads must show a variety of real body shapes
attributes.background: The current position of the Committee of Advertising Practice is that “the use of thin models itself is not considered socially irresponsible.” Advertising Codes reflect UK Law. The Government should therefore make it a legal requirement for advertising to show a variety of real body shapes.
attributes.additional_details:
Images, models and mannequins inform our society:
“81% of 10-year-olds are afraid of being fat." (Rust, 2010 in ukessays.com) 
"The current media ideal of thinness for women is achievable by less than 5% of the female population." 
“…ample empirical research is available documenting associations between idealised images of female beauty and negative effects on women’s (and increasingly men's) physical, psychological, and social well-being (Thompson et al., 1999 in Calogero et al., 2007).

attributes.action: Introduce retaining 5% of price, until remedial work on new homes is completed.
attributes.background: Issues reported in the first two years are the responsibility of the house builder, followed by a further eight years of (structural) NHBC insurance cover.  However, from our experience the rectification of problems are being extended beyond the warranty period and some issues are being refused.
attributes.additional_details: Realistically homes cannot be perfect.  However a timely redress for repairs is now required. Therefore, retaining 5% of the purchase price of the property should prompt builders to rectify concerns without delays. Subsequently, this would allow customers not to feel unhappy and stressed in their new homes.

attributes.action: Examine the benefits of Driver CPC EU Dir 2003/59 with a view to scrapping it.
attributes.background: The driver CPC was initiated as a European Directive to provide periodic training to all vocational licence holders. The scheme is of no benefit and is merely a cash generator for the agencies administering it.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid budget and increase police funding from the savings.
attributes.background: The government proposes increases in council tax to raise £450m extra funding for the police.  Sign this petition if you want the government to reduce foreign aid to cover this cost rather than to further increase our taxes.
attributes.additional_details: In compliance with UN guidelines, the government spends 0.7% per annum on foreign aid, which equated to approximately £12bn in 2015.  Much of this goes toward slush funds and dubious projects in which we, the taxpayer, currently have no say.   This is our money, thus we demand a say.

attributes.action: Outdoor nature-based learning to be compulsory and weekly in all English schools
attributes.background: We believe that not enough children of all ages are being exposed to weekly outdoor sessions in all seasons and all weathers, connecting with nature and involved with sustainability, knowing practical ways to care and protect the world they live in
attributes.additional_details: This campaign is led by a forest school leader.

attributes.action: Change universal credit back to the previous benefit system that worked
attributes.background: Forced off ESA to attend a medical with someone unqualified to be forced onto universal credit which has left myself and many others below the poverty line and homeless!

attributes.action: Stop UK government funding the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."
attributes.background: Major questions have been raised about the actions of the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."

attributes.action: End homelessness in Britain by adopting and funding the "Housing First" project.
attributes.background: There are over 9000 homeless people living on the streets of Britain. Many are ex military men and women suffering from mental health issues. No one chooses to be homeless. Britain can and should eradicate homelessness. The "Housing First" model has already proven to reduce homelessness in Europe.
attributes.additional_details: Finland adopted the "Housing First" model in 2008. To date Finland is the only European country to see homelessness numbers falling. The model is simple: Provide a home first, treat the causes of homelessness and help people to retrain and get back into work and reintegrate into society. Not only is "Housing First" cost effective but it is morally the "right thing to do". Many MP's already support "Housing First". By supporting this petition you could force a parliamentary debate.

attributes.action: Independent review of appointments to Office of Students board
attributes.background: The OfS has responsibility for putting “the student interest at heart” and promoting fair access to HE. Therefore we request an independent review of the appointment process to the board to assure it has been transparent, recruited the best qualified & meets public duties under the Equalities Act.
attributes.additional_details: Given the importance of Higher Education to a prosperous and democratic society, it is important that it is appropriately regulated. This requires a board that understands the sector and is committed to furthering the pursuit of knowledge across all disciplines and for the support of all members of society. Expertise should be drawn from outside and from within the sector. The exclusion of academic and professional services representatives and of a member of the NUS is of particular concern.

attributes.action: Make PSA tests mandatory for all men over 50
attributes.background:
Join Male Cancer charity Balls to Cancer's campaign to get mandatory PSA tests for all men over 50. 
Prostate cancer is the biggest cancer killer for men over 50 in the UK killing 40,000 men annually.
Help us make government make this as important as breast & smear testing
attributes.additional_details: If every man over 50 has a PSA test more cases of prostate cancer could be found and treated early saving many lives.

attributes.action: The government should introduce a truly FAIR funding formula for all schools.
attributes.background: The current funding of schools is unfairly distributed meaning that some schools receive millions of pounds more than others.  A "fair" funding formula was to be introduced for schools but this was dropped, leaving many schools underfunded due to lower real terms funding (i.e. due to inflation etc).
attributes.additional_details:
Some additional funding was given recently but is outweighed by inflationary pressures (increased costs) and additional government requirements.  Schools in some areas are either having to make redundancies or are using up remaining cash reserves.  This is therefore a looming crisis that the government must address before this impacts further on outcomes.

All references to funding made above are "per pupil" and take account of separate funding such as the pupil premium and London weighting.

attributes.action: Make it law that university students get a refund for cancelled lectures
attributes.background: University staff are on strike for 4 weeks. Students have got into debt to cover the costs of their fees and it is only right that as consumers of a service they haven't received they should get a refund. Therefore all lectures scheduled but not delivered should be refunded.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for school children to be punished for dinner money arrears
attributes.background:
A recent incident of a school child being excluded and given bread and water instead of a hot meal or full lunch with friends has highlighted treatment which appears "Dickensian" when small arrears build up for school dinners. 

This must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Children are vulnerable people, who by default cannot consent to or take control of actions revolving around the organisation of their lunch arrangements.

Schools must not be allowed to punish children for what is the responsibility of adults.

There are many legitimate reasons why a payment may be missed or packed lunch misplaced.

Children excluded in this way are liable to long term emotional suffering.

Denying proper food choice is not allowed in prisons. 

It must not be allowed in schools.

attributes.action: Launch an independent inquiry into the 5g Health & Safety risks
attributes.background: There seems to be much proof of the dangers of Mobile Phone masts as it is, and now 5g is to be rolled out with a far greater percentage of phone masts on every street in order to facilitate it. This is, given the evidence so far, a grave risk to each and every person in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Devra Davis
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BwyDCHf5iCY
Brain Tumours Links to Mobile Phone Use
https://academic.oup.com/ije/article/39/3/675/631387
Italian Court Rules Mobile Phones Cause Cancer
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/apr/21/italian-court-rules-mobile-phone-use-caused-brain-tumour

attributes.action: Abolish changes to free school meals
attributes.background: Recent government changes to the free school meal system will mean millions of vulnerable and less well off children will loose out on their only hot meal of the day

attributes.action: Regulate the eyelash extension industry making training compulsory
attributes.background: Let’s make our lash industry safe, by regulating it we avoid non trained individuals to practice without a license. This would minimise the risks of lash and eye damage

attributes.action: Ask UN to take Jerusalem under its protection.
attributes.background: US recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital has emboldened Israel to carry on denying that East Jerusalem is occupied. The only fair solution is to return to the 1947 Partition Plan and make Jerusalem a corpus separatum.

attributes.action: Require DWP assessments for disabled people to take place in hospitals by doctor
attributes.background: DWP assessments should take place in hospitals, not offices, and by doctors, not nurses or other staff. Currently assessments are based on errors, they humiliate people and absolutely no care is shown. Too many people are pushed to appeal.
attributes.additional_details: I’ve been disabled for over 10 years and in my experience, DWP are rude on the phone and there is no care for the individual. I felt humiliated by the assessor who wouldn't even open a door for me. Despite clearly seeing that you’re ill, they try to make you bend, touch your toes, and lean forward which is so humiliating for people. They even look to see if you’ve got nail polish on and whether your clothes are clean. This humiliating process has to stop.

attributes.action: The Nursing & Midwifery Council (NMC) should be a tax-payer funded organisation
attributes.background:
The NMC has been an independent regulatory body, funded by Nurse's & Midwives. 
The main aim of the NMC is to protect patients, whilst regulating practice of Nurse’s and Midwives.
I feel the NMC should be funded by the tax-paying public and not by N&M's, like the Health & Safety Executive is.
attributes.additional_details:
The NMC recently decided to pay their staff an 11% annual pay rise & we are still fighting to get above 1%!
In September 2017, it was reported by the BBC News Online: Fourteen unions joined together to ask for the increase, (3.9%!!), saying pay has fallen by 15% since 2010, once inflation was taken into account. 
How can the NMC justify a £120 annual retention fee, to an organisation, whose primary remit is to protect patients, & have got a massive pay rise?? 
I have colleagues using food banks!

attributes.action: UK Government shouldn’t enact legislation permitting another Scottish referendum
attributes.background: As Alex Salmond stated in 2014, time and time again, “this independence vote is a once in a generation vote.” Yet, come 2016, the SNP are at it again, striving to gain independence from this UK. As a generation equates to 32 years, let us make sure that they cannot seek indyref2 until at least 2046.

attributes.action: Legislate that all UK constitutional referenda must have a super majority
attributes.background:
Legislate that all UK future constitutional referenda (like Brexit & Scotlands Independence ref) must have a super majority of at least 60% to effect change. Furthermore there should be a minimum 75% turnout.
Enacting this legislation would ensure there was a clear irrefutable majority for change.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of the change is to embed the principle of a real and unarguable will for change in law & the constitution. Both recent UK referendums has caused untold division within society & has caused attention post these referendums to be focused on that division rather than than more critical & essential matters of state & local politics.

attributes.action: Require any driver with points on their licence to have Black Box Car Insurance
attributes.background:
With over 1,700 people dying and over 180,000 injured on our roads every year, and with 80% of drivers breaking the 20mph speed limits, bad driving has created a huge cost to society.

The Black Box Car Insurance policy significantly modifies driver behaviour making them into model drivers.
attributes.additional_details:
A driving licence is a licence to drive motorised vehicles on our roads after demonstrating competence at driving and knowledge of the Highway Code. 

Drivers with points on their licence have demonstrated they are driving poorly. Black Box technology can educate a bad driver to become a good driver and highlight bad driving. This is shown by the low premiums being offered to young drivers by black box policies. 

Banned drivers should have a lifetime requirement to use Black Box Insurance.

attributes.action: Financial support &employment support/protection for women with endometriosis
attributes.background: 1 in 10 women suffer with endometriosis in the UK. Women are losing their jobs, having financial difficulties, being treated unfairly by employers and are not protected even though this is a long term chronic illness with no cure. We need protection and help please. Repeat surgeries and treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
Endometriosis falls under the NHS most 20 painful conditions https://www.nhs.uk/Livewell/Pain/Pages/20-painful-conditions.aspx 
 
This illness is serious, we are having surgeries every year some of us and more than once a year. However, we've no protection in work and it is not recognised by all employers as serious and we are not fully protected by the disability act or any act. 

Some women have been fired, we have no benefits available to us either if we are no longer able to work.
